document_data.name: Mountain Goat
document_data.Description: Mountain goats had thick, white fur and a thick layer of fat. This provided it with ample protection from the cold.
document_data.Behavior: Mountain goats were territorial and had a reputation for being incredibly stubborn creatures. As a result, they were quite difficult to domesticate.
document_data.Abilities: Mountain goats were sure-footed on most alpine terrain. Their superb climbing ability allowed them to scale even the steepest of cliffs and they were capable of jumping from one narrow ledge to another.
document_data.Combat: When threatened, a mountain goat rammed its opponent.

Ecology.Habitats:
Mountain goats could be encountered throughout the Realms, including [[Adama's Tooth]], [[Fimbrul]], [[Ice Peak]], [[Kelvin's Cairn]], the mountains of [[Maztica]], [[Shalhoond]], [[Shining Plains]], the [[Spine of the World]], the [[Tannath Mountains]], the [[Valley of Echoes]] and the [[World Pillar Mountains]].{{Cite dragon/241/Campaign Classics: The Roof of the World}}

Beyond the [[Prime Material plane]], mountain goats could be found in the land of [[Barovia]].
Ecology.Relationships:
[[Goliath]] tribes were known to tend herds of mountain goats and their youths sometimes used them as [[mount]]s.

[[Oread]]s sometimes developed friendships with mountain goats.
Ecology.Usage: Mountain goats could be employed as cavalry. Known examples include the [[goblin]] and [[orc]]s of the Shining Plains

document_data.Trivia: * Mountain goats were the holy symbol of the outsider deity [[Enki]].
